Key Match Events: Evin Lewis hammered eight sixes on his way to 94 off 69 balls
England's more experienced opening pair, Phil Salt and Will Jacks, got off to a positive start before both were removed by Jayden Seales inside the opening five overs
Jacob Bethell's dismissal left the tourists languishing on 93-4
Pre-Game Insights: England captain Liam Livingstone said, 'I think the test we have to come over the next few games is to get into the rhythms of 50-over cricket.'
England named four ODI debutants for the first of three matches against the West Indies
England's more experienced opening pair, Phil Salt and Will Jacks, were rested at home
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies skipper Shai Hope said, 'Evin Lewis is experienced and has been around for a long time. You can see he is a different beast. He's hungry. I'm glad with the scores he's getting now.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was rain-affected and the hosts made a fine start to their reply before a rain delay gave them a new target via the Duckworth–Lewis–Stern (DLS) method
England have a record of 11 defeats in their last 17 ODIs
